Sending an active message to an other process

Compilation

Simply enter in your build directory examples: 

      > make am

Running

Simply enter 

      > ./am 6 totojdqmjdlq hjdfql todo

that will produces 


Source


00001 // ==========================================================================
00002 // (c) INRIA, projet MOAIS, 2006
00003 // see the copyright file for more information
00004 // Author: T. Gautier
00005 // - This example shows how to send an active message to an other process.
00006 // ==========================================================================
00007 #include "kaapi_network"
00008 #include "kaapi_sched"
00009 #include "utils_fwd.h"
00010 #include <iostream>
00011 #include <iomanip>
00012 
00013 
00014 class Synchro: public Net::Group, public Util::Object {
00015 public:
00016   static Synchro synchro;
00017 
00018   /** Initialization
00019    */
00020   void initialize()
00021   {
00022     Net::Group::initialize();
00023     Util::Object::initialize();
00024   }
00025 
00026   /** Terminate
00027    */
00028   void terminate()
00029   {
00030     Net::Group::terminate();
00031     Util::Object::terminate();
00032   }
00033 
00034   /** Wait until at least n nodes are join the group
00035    */
00036   void wait( unsigned int n )
00037   {
00038     Util::CriticalGuard critical(*this);
00039     // While the size of the group is less than n
00040     while (size() < n)
00041     {
00042       // Wait... using the method from the class hierarchy: Net::Group::Util::Object::Condition::wait
00043       KAAPI_LOG(Util::Init::verboseon, "[Sched::Synchro::wait] still waiting for " << n -size() << " node(s) (" << size() << " node(s) joined).");
00044       Util::Object::wait( *this );
00045     }
00046     KAAPI_LOG(Util::Init::verboseon, "[Sched::Synchro::wait] " << size() << " nodes have joined. Let's go !");
00047   }
00048 
00049 protected:
00050   /** Inherited from group to capture join/leave/user events
00051    */
00052   void notify( Net::GlobalId gid, int e, Util::ka_uint64_t value, const char* arg)
00053   {
00054     KAAPI_LOG(false||Util::Init::verboseon, "[Sched::Synchro::notify] " << size() << " nodes have joined. Let's go !");
00055     // Condition::signal should occurs only if condition size() >= n
00056     if (e == Net::Group::E_JOIN)
00057     {
00058       Util::CriticalGuard critical(*this);
00059       Util::Object::broadcast();
00060     }
00061   }  
00062 };
00063 
00064 /*
00065 */
00066 Synchro Synchro::synchro;
00067 
00068 
00069 /* Pong
00070 */
00071 class Pong: public Net::Service, public Util::Object {
00072 public:
00073   Pong( )
00074    : Net::Service()
00075   { }
00076 
00077   void initialize()
00078   { 
00079     Util::Object::initialize(); 
00080   }
00081   
00082   void teminate()
00083   { 
00084     Util::Object::terminate(); 
00085   }
00086 
00087   void call( Net::CallStack* cc )
00088   {
00089     Util::CriticalGuard critical(*this);
00090     _recv = true;
00091     signal();
00092   }
00093   
00094   void clear()
00095   { _recv = false; }
00096   
00097   void wait()
00098   {
00099     Util::CriticalGuard critical(*this);
00100     while (!_recv)
00101       Util::Object::wait(*this);
00102   }
00103 
00104 protected:
00105   bool _recv;
00106 };
00107 Pong service_pong;
00108 
00109 
00110 /* Ping
00111 */
00112 class Ping: public Net::Service {
00113 public:
00114   Ping( )
00115    : Net::Service(), _count(0)
00116   { }
00117 
00118   void initialize( int maxiter )
00119   { _maxiter = maxiter; }
00120 
00121   void call( Net::CallStack* cc )
00122   {
00123     if (++_count == _maxiter)
00124     {
00125       Net::NodeInfo* ni = 0;
00126       ni = Net::Init::network->globalid_to_nodeinfo(cc->src);
00127       Net::OutChannel* out_channel = Net::Init::network->get_default_local_route( ni );
00128       _count = 0;
00129       Net::Message am;
00130       am.open(
00131         Net::P_AM,            
00132         &service_pong, 
00133         out_channel
00134       );
00135       am.close(0);
00136     }
00137   }
00138 
00139 protected:
00140   int _count;
00141   int _maxiter;
00142 };
00143 Ping service_ping;
00144 
00145 
00146 /* Main of the program:
00147 */
00148 int main (int argc, char* argv[])
00149 {
00150   try {
00151     // initialize Network library and return the default network
00152     Net::Init::component.is_required_by();
00153     WS::Init::component.is_required_by();
00154     Sched::Init::component.is_required_by();
00155     Util::KaapiComponentManager::initialize( argc, argv );
00156     Net::Network* net = Net::Init::network;
00157     
00158     int size_max = atoi(argv[1]);   /* byte */
00159     int size_incr = atoi(argv[2]);  /* incr */
00160     int niter = atoi(argv[3]);      /* #iter */
00161 
00162     Synchro::synchro.initialize();
00163     Synchro::synchro.setup( net, "toto", Net::GlobalId::fromint(0) );
00164     Synchro::synchro.join();
00165     Synchro::synchro.wait( 2 );
00166 
00167     // 
00168     service_pong.initialize();
00169     service_ping.initialize(niter);
00170     Net::Service::Manager.bind (1, &service_pong);
00171     Net::Service::Manager.bind (2, &service_ping);
00172 
00173     while ( WS::Init::world->size() < 2 )
00174     {
00175       Util::logfile() << "[am_ping] waiting for the other node" << std::endl;
00176       Util::Thread::sleep( 1000 );
00177     }    
00178     
00179     // get a channel in direction to node with local identifier '1'
00180     Net::OutChannel* channel =0;
00181     if (Util::Init::local_gid != 0U) 
00182     {
00183       Util::GlobalId gid_dest;
00184       gid_dest = 0;
00185       Net::NodeInfo* ni = net->globalid_to_nodeinfo(gid_dest);
00186       channel = net->get_default_local_route(ni);
00187 
00188       std::cout << "#Size (Ko)   latency(us) niter " << niter << std::endl;      
00189       for (int size=0; size<=size_max; size += size_incr)
00190       {
00191         char* data = new char[size];
00192         
00193         service_pong.clear();
00194         double t0 = Util::WallTimer::gettime();
00195         for (int i=0; i<niter; ++i)
00196         {
00197           Util::CriticalGuard  critical(channel);
00198           // the message
00199           Net::Message am;
00200           
00201           // open the message of type ActiveMessage for 'service' onto channel 'channel'
00202           am.open(
00203             Net::P_AM,            
00204             &service_ping, 
00205             channel
00206           );
00207           am.put( data, size );
00208           am.close( 0 );
00209         }
00210         service_pong.wait();
00211         double t1 = Util::WallTimer::gettime();
00212         delete [] data;
00213         std::cout << size/1024.0 << "\t " << ((t1-t0)/niter)*1e6 << std::endl;
00214       }
00215     }
00216     
00217     /* infinite loop */
00218     while (1)
00219       Util::Thread::sleep(5000,0);
00220     
00221     Net::Service::Manager.unbind (1);
00222     Net::Service::Manager.unbind (2);
00223     service_pong.terminate();
00224     
00225     Util::KaapiComponentManager::terminate( );
00226 
00227     return 0;
00228 
00229   } catch (Util::RuntimeError& ex) {
00230     std::cerr << "[Main]: catch exception '" << ex.what() << "'" << std::endl;
00231   } catch (...) {
00232     std::cerr << "[Main]: catch an unknown exception" << std::endl;
00233   }
00234   return -1;
00235 }
